00352 static void vhci_timer(unsigned long _vhc)
00353 {
00354     struct vhci *vhc = (struct vhci *)_vhc;
00355 }
00356 */
00357 
00358 static int vhci_hub_status(struct usb_hcd *hcd, char *buf)
00359 {
00360     struct vhci *vhc;
00361     unsigned long flags;
00362     u8 port;
00363     int retval = 0;
00364 
00365     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00366 
00367     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00368 
00369     memset(buf, 0, 1 + vhc->port_count / 8);
00370 
00371     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00372     if(!test_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags))
00373     {
00374         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00375         return 0;
00376     }
00377 
00378     for(port = 0; port < vhc->port_count; port++)
00379     {
00380         if(vhc->ports[port].port_change)
00381         {
00382             __set_bit(port + 1, (unsigned long *)buf);
00383             retval = 1;
00384         }
00385 #ifdef DEBUG
00386         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "port %d status 0x%04x has changes at 0x%04x\n", (int)(port + 1), (int)vhc->ports[port].port_status, (int)vhc->ports[port].port_change);
00387 #endif
00388     }
00389 
00390     if(vhc->rh_state == VHCI_RH_SUSPENDED)
00391         usb_hcd_resume_root_hub(hcd);
00392 
00393     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00394     return retval;
00395 }
00396 
00397 // caller has lock
00398 // called in vhci_hub_control only
00399 static inline void hub_descriptor(const struct vhci *vhc, char *buf, u16 len)
00400 {
00401     u16 l = sizeof(struct usb_hub_descriptor);
00402     char temp[USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE];
00403     struct usb_hub_descriptor *const desc = (struct usb_hub_descriptor *const)temp;
00404 
00405     if(likely(len > USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE))
00406     {
00407         if(unlikely(len < l)) l = len;
00408         if(likely(l > USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE))
00409             memset(buf + USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE, 0xff, l - USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE);
00410     }
00411     else l = len;
00412 
00413     memset(temp, 0, USB_DT_HUB_NONVAR_SIZE);
00414     desc->bDescLength = l;
00415     desc->bDescriptorType = 0x29;
00416     desc->bNbrPorts = vhc->port_count;
00417     desc->wHubCharacteristics = __constant_cpu_to_le16(0x0009); // Per port power and overcurrent
00418     memcpy(buf, temp, l);
00419 }
00420 
00421 // caller has lock
00422 // first port is port# 1 (not 0)
00423 static inline void userspace_needs_port_update(struct vhci *vhc, u8 port)
00424 {
00425     __set_bit(port, (unsigned long *)&vhc->port_update);
00426     trigger_work_event(vhc);
00427 }
00428 
00429 static int vhci_hub_control(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
00430                             u16 typeReq,
00431                             u16 wValue,
00432                             u16 wIndex,
00433                             char *buf,
00434                             u16 wLength)
00435 {
00436     struct vhci *vhc;
00437     int retval = 0;
00438     unsigned long flags;
00439     u16 *ps, *pc;
00440     u8 *pf;
00441     u8 port, has_changes = 0;
00442 
00443     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00444 
00445     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00446 
00447     if(unlikely(!test_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags)))
00448         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00449 
00450     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00451 
00452     switch(typeReq)
00453     {
00454     case ClearHubFeature:
00455     case SetHubFeature:
00456 #ifdef DEBUG
00457         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: %sHubFeature [wValue=0x%04x]\n", __FUNCTION__, (typeReq == ClearHubFeature) ? "Clear" : "Set", (int)wValue);
00458 #endif
00459         if(unlikely(wIndex || wLength || (wValue != C_HUB_LOCAL_POWER && wValue != C_HUB_OVER_CURRENT)))
00460             goto err;
00461         break;
00462     case ClearPortFeature:
00463 #ifdef DEBUG
00464         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: ClearPortFeature [wValue=0x%04x, wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex);
00465 #endif
00466         if(unlikely(!wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength))
00467             goto err;
00468         ps = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status;
00469         pc = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change;
00470         pf = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_flags;
00471         switch(wValue)
00472         {
00473         case USB_PORT_FEAT_SUSPEND:
00474             // (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.5 und 11.24.2.7.1.3)
00475             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND)
00476             {
00477 #ifdef DEBUG
00478                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d resuming\n", (int)wIndex);
00479 #endif
00480                 __set_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)pf);
00481                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00482             }
00483             break;
00484         case USB_PORT_FEAT_POWER:
00485             // (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.11 und 11.24.2.7.1.6)
00486             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_POWER)
00487             {
00488 #ifdef DEBUG
00489                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d power-off\n", (int)wIndex);
00490 #endif
00491                 // Alle status bits l√∂schen, au√üer overcurrent (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.24.2.7.1)
00492                 *ps &= USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
00493                 // Alle change bits l√∂schen, au√üer overcurrent (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.24.2.7.2)
00494                 *pc &= USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT;
00495                 // Falls resuming gesetzt
00496                 __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)pf);
00497                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00498             }
00499             break;
00500         case USB_PORT_FEAT_ENABLE:
00501             // (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.5.1.4 und 11.24.2.7.{1,2}.2)
00502             if(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE)
00503             {
00504 #ifdef DEBUG
00505                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d disabled\n", (int)wIndex);
00506 #endif
00507                 // Enable und suspend bits l√∂schen (siehe Sektion 11.24.2.7.1.{2,3})
00508                 *ps &= ~(USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE | USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND);
00509                 // Nicht ganz sicher, ob suspend change bit auch gel√∂scht werden soll (siehe Sektion 11.24.2.7.2.{2,3})
00510                 *pc &= ~(USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE | USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND);
00511                 // Falls resuming gesetzt
00512                 __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)pf);
00513                 // TODO: Vielleicht hier die low und high speed bits l√∂schen (Sektion 11.24.2.7.1.{7,8})
00514                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00515             }
00516             break;
00517         case USB_PORT_FEAT_CONNECTION:
00518         case USB_PORT_FEAT_OVER_CURRENT:
00519         case USB_PORT_FEAT_RESET:
00520         case USB_PORT_FEAT_LOWSPEED:
00521         case USB_PORT_FEAT_HIGHSPEED:
00522         case USB_PORT_FEAT_INDICATOR:
00523             break; // no-op
00524         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_CONNECTION:
00525         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_ENABLE:
00526         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_SUSPEND:
00527         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_OVER_CURRENT:
00528         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_RESET:
00529             if(__test_and_clear_bit(wValue - 16, (unsigned long *)pc))
00530                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00531             break;
00532         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_TEST:
00533         default:
00534             goto err;
00535         }
00536         break;
00537     case GetHubDescriptor:
00538 #ifdef DEBUG
00539         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetHubDescriptor [wValue=0x%04x, wLength=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wLength);
00540 #endif
00541         if(unlikely(wIndex))
00542             goto err;
00543         hub_descriptor(vhc, buf, wLength);
00544         break;
00545     case GetHubStatus:
00546 #ifdef DEBUG
00547         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetHubStatus\n", __FUNCTION__);
00548 #endif
00549         if(unlikely(wValue || wIndex || wLength != 4))
00550             goto err;
00551         *(__le32 *)buf = __constant_cpu_to_le32(0);
00552         break;
00553     case GetPortStatus:
00554 #ifdef DEBUG
00555         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: GetPortStatus [wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wIndex);
00556 #endif
00557         if(unlikely(wValue || !wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength != 4))
00558             goto err;
00559 #ifdef DEBUG
00560         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: ==> [port_status=0x%04x] [port_change=0x%04x]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status, (int)vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change);
00561 #endif
00562         ((__le16 *)buf)[0] = cpu_to_le16(vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status);
00563         ((__le16 *)buf)[1] = cpu_to_le16(vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change);
00564         break;
00565     case SetPortFeature:
00566 #ifdef DEBUG
00567         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: SetPortFeature [wValue=0x%04x, wIndex=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex);
00568 #endif
00569         if(unlikely(!wIndex || wIndex > vhc->port_count || wLength))
00570             goto err;
00571         ps = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_status;
00572         pc = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_change;
00573         pf = &vhc->ports[wIndex - 1].port_flags;
00574         switch(wValue)
00575         {
00576         case USB_PORT_FEAT_SUSPEND:
00577             // USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.24.2.7.1.3:
00578             //  "This bit can be set only if the port‚Äôs PORT_ENABLE bit is set and the hub receives
00579             //  a SetPortFeature(PORT_SUSPEND) request."
00580             // Aus dem darauf folgendem Satz geht au√üerdem hervor, dass das suspend bit gel√∂scht werden soll,
00581             // wann immer das enable bit gel√∂scht wird.
00582             // (siehe auch Sektion 11.5)
00583             if((*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE) && !(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND))
00584             {
00585 #ifdef DEBUG
00586                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d suspended\n", (int)wIndex);
00587 #endif
00588                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND;
00589                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00590             }
00591             break;
00592         case USB_PORT_FEAT_POWER:
00593             // (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.11 und 11.24.2.7.1.6)
00594             if(!(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_POWER))
00595             {
00596 #ifdef DEBUG
00597                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d power-on\n", (int)wIndex);
00598 #endif
00599                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_POWER;
00600                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00601             }
00602             break;
00603         case USB_PORT_FEAT_RESET:
00604             // (siehe USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.24.2.7.1.5)
00605             // Reset nur dann durchf√ºhren, wenn ein Device am Port h√§ngt und das Reset Signal nicht bereits anliegt
00606             if((*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION) && !(*ps & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET))
00607             {
00608 #ifdef DEBUG
00609                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d resetting\n", (int)wIndex);
00610 #endif
00611 
00612                 // Den Zustand dieser Bits beibehalten und alle anderen l√∂schen
00613                 *ps &= USB_PORT_STAT_POWER
00614                      | USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION
00615                      | USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED
00616                      | USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED
00617                      | USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
00618 
00619                 *ps |= USB_PORT_STAT_RESET; // Reset Vorgang eingeleitet
00620 
00621                 // Falls resuming gesetzt
00622                 __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)pf);
00623 
00624                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00625             }
00626 #ifdef DEBUG
00627             else if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d reset not possible because of port_state=%04x\n", (int)wIndex, (int)*ps);
00628 #endif
00629             break;
00630         case USB_PORT_FEAT_CONNECTION:
00631         case USB_PORT_FEAT_OVER_CURRENT:
00632         case USB_PORT_FEAT_LOWSPEED:
00633         case USB_PORT_FEAT_HIGHSPEED:
00634         case USB_PORT_FEAT_INDICATOR:
00635             break; // no-op
00636         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_CONNECTION:
00637         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_ENABLE:
00638         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_SUSPEND:
00639         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_OVER_CURRENT:
00640         case USB_PORT_FEAT_C_RESET:
00641             if(!__test_and_set_bit(wValue - 16, (unsigned long *)pc))
00642                 userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, wIndex);
00643             break;
00644         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_ENABLE: // Port wird nur nach einem Reset enabled. (USB 2.0 spec Sektion 11.24.2.7.1.2)
00645         //case USB_PORT_FEAT_TEST:
00646         default:
00647             goto err;
00648         }
00649         break;
00650     default:
00651 #ifdef DEBUG
00652         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: +++UNHANDLED_REQUEST+++ [req=0x%04x, v=0x%04x, i=0x%04x, l=%d]\n", __FUNCTION__, (int)typeReq, (int)wValue, (int)wIndex, (int)wLength);
00653 #endif
00654 err:
00655 #ifdef DEBUG
00656         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "%s: STALL\n", __FUNCTION__);
00657 #endif
00658         // "protocol stall" on error
00659         retval = -EPIPE;
00660     }
00661 
00662     for(port = 0; port < vhc->port_count; port++)
00663         if(vhc->ports[port].port_change)
00664             has_changes = 1;
00665 
00666     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00667 
00668     if(has_changes)
00669         usb_hcd_poll_rh_status(hcd);
00670     return retval;
00671 }
00672 
00673 static int vhci_bus_suspend(struct usb_hcd *hcd)
00674 {
00675     struct vhci *vhc;
00676     unsigned long flags;
00677     u8 port;
00678 
00679     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00680 
00681     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00682 
00683     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00684 
00685     // Ports suspenden
00686     for(port = 0; port < vhc->port_count; port++)
00687     {
00688         if((vhc->ports[port].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE) &&
00689             !(vhc->ports[port].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND))
00690         {
00691             dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "Port %d suspended\n", (int)port + 1);
00692             vhc->ports[port].port_status |= USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND;
00693             __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)&vhc->ports[port].port_flags);
00694             userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, port + 1);
00695         }
00696     }
00697 
00698     // TODO: Irgendwie verhindern, dass einzelne Ports resumed werden, w√§hrend der Bus suspended ist.
00699 
00700     vhc->rh_state = VHCI_RH_SUSPENDED;
00701     hcd->state = HC_STATE_SUSPENDED;
00702 
00703     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00704 
00705     return 0;
00706 }
00707 
00708 static int vhci_bus_resume(struct usb_hcd *hcd)
00709 {
00710     struct vhci *vhc;
00711     int rc = 0;
00712     unsigned long flags;
00713 
00714     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00715 
00716     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00717 
00718     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00719     if(unlikely(!test_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags)))
00720     {
00721         dev_warn(&hcd->self.root_hub->dev, "HC isn't running! You have to resume the host controller device before you resume the root hub.\n");
00722         rc = -ENODEV;
00723     }
00724     else
00725     {
00726         vhc->rh_state = VHCI_RH_RUNNING;
00727         //set_link_state(vhc);
00728         hcd->state = HC_STATE_RUNNING;
00729     }
00730     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00731 
00732     return rc;
00733 }
00734 
00735 static inline ssize_t show_urb(char *buf, size_t size, struct urb *urb)
00736 {
00737     int ep = usb_pipeendpoint(urb->pipe);
00738 
00739     return snprintf(buf, size,
00740         "urb/%p %s ep%d%s%s len %d/%d\n",
00741         urb,
00742         ({
00743             char *s;
00744             switch(urb->dev->speed)
00745             {
00746             case USB_SPEED_LOW:  s = "ls"; break;
00747             case USB_SPEED_FULL: s = "fs"; break;
00748             case USB_SPEED_HIGH: s = "hs"; break;
00749             default:             s = "?";  break;
00750             };
00751             s;
00752         }),
00753         ep, ep ? (usb_pipein(urb->pipe) ? "in" : "out") : "",
00754         ({
00755             char *s;
00756             switch(usb_pipetype(urb->pipe))
00757             {
00758             case PIPE_CONTROL:   s = "";      break;
00759             case PIPE_BULK:      s = "-bulk"; break;
00760             case PIPE_INTERRUPT: s = "-int";  break;
00761             default:             s = "-iso";  break;
00762             };
00763             s;
00764         }),
00765         urb->actual_length, urb->transfer_buffer_length);
00766 }
00767 
00768 #ifdef DEBUG
00769 static void dump_urb(struct urb *urb)
00770 {
00771     int i, j;
00772     int max = urb->transfer_buffer_length;
00773     int in = usb_pipein(urb->pipe);
00774     if(!debug_output) return;
00775     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "dump_urb 0x%016llx:\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urb);
00776     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "dvadr=0x%02x epnum=%d epdir=%s eptpe=%s\n", (int)usb_pipedevice(urb->pipe), (int)usb_pipeendpoint(urb->pipe), (in ? "IN" : "OUT"), (usb_pipecontrol(urb->pipe) ? "CTRL" : (usb_pipebulk(urb->pipe) ? "BULK" : (usb_pipeint(urb->pipe) ? "INT" : (usb_pipeisoc(urb->pipe) ? "ISO" : "INV!")))));
00777 #ifdef OLD_GIVEBACK_MECH
00778     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "status=%d(%s) flags=0x%08x buflen=%d/%d\n", urb->status, get_status_str(urb->status), urb->transfer_flags, urb->actual_length, max);
00779 #else
00780     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "flags=0x%08x buflen=%d/%d\n", urb->transfer_flags, urb->actual_length, max);
00781 #endif
00782     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "tbuf=0x%p tdma=0x%016llx sbuf=0x%p sdma=0x%016llx\n", urb->transfer_buffer, (u64)urb->transfer_dma, urb->setup_packet, (u64)urb->setup_dma);
00783     if(usb_pipeint(urb->pipe))
00784         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "interval=%d\n", urb->interval);
00785     else if(usb_pipeisoc(urb->pipe))
00786         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "interval=%d err=%d packets=%d startfrm=%d\n", urb->interval, urb->error_count, urb->number_of_packets, urb->start_frame);
00787     else if(usb_pipecontrol(urb->pipe))
00788     {
00789         const char *const sr[13] =
00790         {
00791             "GET_STATUS",
00792             "CLEAR_FEATURE",
00793             "reserved",
00794             "SET_FEATURE",
00795             "reserved",
00796             "SET_ADDRESS",
00797             "GET_DESCRIPTOR",
00798             "SET_DESCRIPTOR",
00799             "GET_CONFIGURATION",
00800             "SET_CONFIGURATION",
00801             "GET_INTERFACE",
00802             "SET_INTERFACE",
00803             "SYNCH_FRAME"
00804         };
00805         const char *const sd[9] =
00806         {
00807             "invalid",
00808             "DEVICE",
00809             "CONFIGURATION",
00810             "STRING",
00811             "INTERFACE",
00812             "ENDPOINT",
00813             "DEVICE_QUALIFIER",
00814             "OTHER_SPEED_CONFIGURATION",
00815             "INTERFACE_POWER"
00816         };
00817         const char *const sf[3] =
00818         {
00819             "ENDPOINT_HALT",
00820             "DEVICE_REMOTE_WAKEUP",
00821             "TEST_MODE"
00822         };
00823         max = urb->setup_packet[6] | (urb->setup_packet[7] << 8);
00824         in = urb->setup_packet[0] & 0x80;
00825         if(urb->setup_packet == NULL)
00826             vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "(!!!) setup_packet is NULL\n");
00827         else
00828         {
00829             unsigned int val = urb->setup_packet[2] | (urb->setup_packet[3] << 8);
00830             vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "bRequestType=0x%02x(%s,%s,%s) bRequest=0x%02x(%s)\n",
00831                 (int)urb->setup_packet[0],
00832                 in ? "IN" : "OUT",
00833                 (((urb->setup_packet[0] >> 5) & 0x03) == 0) ? "STD" : ((((urb->setup_packet[0] >> 5) & 0x03) == 1) ? "CLS" : ((((urb->setup_packet[0] >> 5) & 0x03) == 2) ? "VDR" : "???")),
00834                 ((urb->setup_packet[0] & 0x1f) == 0) ? "DV" : (((urb->setup_packet[0] & 0x1f) == 1) ? "IF" : (((urb->setup_packet[0] & 0x1f) == 2) ? "EP" : (((urb->setup_packet[0] & 0x1f) == 3) ? "OT" : "??"))),
00835                 (int)urb->setup_packet[1],
00836                 (((urb->setup_packet[0] >> 5) & 0x03) == 0 && urb->setup_packet[1] < 13) ? sr[urb->setup_packet[1]] : "???");
00837             vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "wValue=0x%04x", val);
00838             if(((urb->setup_packet[0] >> 5) & 0x03) == 0)
00839             {
00840                 if(urb->setup_packet[1] == 1 || urb->setup_packet[1] == 3)
00841                     printk("(%s)", (val < 3) ? sf[val] : "???");
00842                 else if(urb->setup_packet[1] == 6 || urb->setup_packet[1] == 7)
00843                     printk("(%s)", (urb->setup_packet[3] < 9) ? sd[urb->setup_packet[3]] : "???");
00844             }
00845             printk(" wIndex=0x%04x wLength=0x%04x\n", urb->setup_packet[4] | (urb->setup_packet[5] << 8), max);
00846         }
00847     }
00848     if(usb_pipeisoc(urb->pipe))
00849     {
00850         for(j = 0; j < urb->number_of_packets; j++)
00851         {
00852             vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "PACKET%d: offset=%d pktlen=%d/%d status=%d(%s)\n", j, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].actual_length, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].length, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].status, get_status_str(urb->iso_frame_desc[j].status));
00853             if(debug_output >= 2)
00854             {
00855                 vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "PACKET%d: data stage (%d/%d bytes %s):\n", j, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].actual_length, urb->iso_frame_desc[j].length, in ? "received" : "transmitted");
00856                 vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "PACKET%d: ", j);
00857                 max = in ? urb->iso_frame_desc[j].actual_length : urb->iso_frame_desc[j].length;
00858                 if(debug_output > 2 || max <= 16)
00859                     for(i = urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset; i < max + urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset; i++)
00860                         printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00861                 else
00862                 {
00863                     for(i = urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset; i < 8 + urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset; i++)
00864                         printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00865                     printk("... ");
00866                     for(i = max + urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset - 8; i < max + urb->iso_frame_desc[j].offset; i++)
00867                         printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00868                 }
00869                 printk("\n");
00870             }
00871         }
00872     }
00873     else if(debug_output >= 2)
00874     {
00875         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "data stage (%d/%d bytes %s):\n", urb->actual_length, max, in ? "received" : "transmitted");
00876         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "");
00877         if(in) max = urb->actual_length;
00878         if(debug_output > 2 || max <= 16)
00879             for(i = 0; i < max; i++)
00880                 printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00881         else
00882         {
00883             for(i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00884                 printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00885             printk("... ");
00886             for(i = max - 8; i < max; i++)
00887                 printk("%02x ", (unsigned int)((unsigned char*)urb->transfer_buffer)[i]);
00888         }
00889         printk("\n");
00890     }
00891 }
00892 #else
00893 static inline void dump_urb(struct urb *urb) {/* do nothing */}
00894 #endif
00895 
00896 static ssize_t show_urbs(struct device *dev, struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf);
00897 static DEVICE_ATTR(urbs_inbox,     S_IRUSR, show_urbs, NULL);
00898 static DEVICE_ATTR(urbs_fetched,   S_IRUSR, show_urbs, NULL);
00899 static DEVICE_ATTR(urbs_cancel,    S_IRUSR, show_urbs, NULL);
00900 static DEVICE_ATTR(urbs_canceling, S_IRUSR, show_urbs, NULL);
00901 
00902 static ssize_t show_urbs(struct device *dev, struct device_attribute *attr, char *buf)
00903 {
00904     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
00905     struct vhci *vhc;
00906     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
00907     size_t size = 0;
00908     unsigned long flags;
00909     struct list_head *list;
00910 
00911     hcd = dev_get_drvdata(dev);
00912     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00913 
00914     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00915 
00916     if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_inbox)
00917         list = &vhc->urbp_list_inbox;
00918     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_fetched)
00919         list = &vhc->urbp_list_fetched;
00920     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_cancel)
00921         list = &vhc->urbp_list_cancel;
00922     else if(attr == &dev_attr_urbs_canceling)
00923         list = &vhc->urbp_list_canceling;
00924     else
00925     {
00926         dev_err(vhci_dev(vhc), "unreachable code reached... wtf?\n");
00927         return -EINVAL;
00928     }
00929 
00930     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
00931     list_for_each_entry(urbp, list, urbp_list)
00932     {
00933         size_t temp;
00934 
00935         temp = PAGE_SIZE - size;
00936         if(unlikely(temp <= 0)) break;
00937 
00938         temp = show_urb(buf, temp, urbp->urb);
00939         buf += temp;
00940         size += temp;
00941     }
00942     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
00943 
00944     return size;
00945 }
00946 
00947 static int vhci_start(struct usb_hcd *hcd)
00948 {
00949     struct vhci *vhc;
00950     int retval;
00951     struct vhci_port *ports;
00952     struct vhci_conf *conf;
00953 
00954     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
00955 
00956     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
00957 
00958     conf = dev_to_vhci_conf(vhci_dev(vhc));
00959 
00960     ports = kzalloc(conf->port_count * sizeof(struct vhci_port), GFP_KERNEL);
00961     if(unlikely(ports == NULL)) return -ENOMEM;
00962 
00963     spin_lock_init(&vhc->lock);
00964     //init_timer(&vhc->timer);
00965     //vhc->timer.function = vhci_timer;
00966     //vhc->timer.data = (unsigned long)vhc;
00967     vhc->ports = ports;
00968     vhc->port_count = conf->port_count;
00969     vhc->port_sched_offset = 0;
00970     vhc->port_update = 0;
00971     atomic_set(&vhc->frame_num, 0);
00972     init_waitqueue_head(&vhc->work_event);
00973     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vhc->urbp_list_inbox);
00974     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vhc->urbp_list_fetched);
00975     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vhc->urbp_list_cancel);
00976     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vhc->urbp_list_canceling);
00977     vhc->rh_state = VHCI_RH_RUNNING;
00978 
00979     hcd->power_budget = 30000; // haben genug davon, weil virtuell
00980     hcd->state = HC_STATE_RUNNING;
00981     hcd->uses_new_polling = 1;
00982 
00983     retval = device_create_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_inbox);
00984     if(unlikely(retval != 0)) goto kfree_port_arr;
00985 
00986     retval = device_create_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_fetched);
00987     if(unlikely(retval != 0)) goto rem_file_inbox;
00988 
00989     retval = device_create_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_cancel);
00990     if(unlikely(retval != 0)) goto rem_file_fetched;
00991 
00992     retval = device_create_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_canceling);
00993     if(unlikely(retval != 0)) goto rem_file_cancel;
00994 
00995     return 0;
00996 
00997 rem_file_cancel:
00998     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_cancel);
00999 
01000 rem_file_fetched:
01001     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_fetched);
01002 
01003 rem_file_inbox:
01004     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_inbox);
01005 
01006 kfree_port_arr:
01007     kfree(ports);
01008     vhc->ports = NULL;
01009     vhc->port_count = 0;
01010     return retval;
01011 }
01012 
01013 static void vhci_stop(struct usb_hcd *hcd)
01014 {
01015     struct vhci *vhc;
01016 
01017     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
01018 
01019     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
01020 
01021     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_canceling);
01022     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_cancel);
01023     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_fetched);
01024     device_remove_file(vhci_dev(vhc), &dev_attr_urbs_inbox);
01025 
01026     if(likely(vhc->ports))
01027     {
01028         kfree(vhc->ports);
01029         vhc->ports = NULL;
01030         vhc->port_count = 0;
01031     }
01032 
01033     vhc->rh_state = VHCI_RH_RESET;
01034 
01035     dev_info(vhci_dev(vhc), "stopped\n");
01036 }
01037 
01038 static int vhci_get_frame(struct usb_hcd *hcd)
01039 {
01040     struct vhci *vhc;
01041     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
01042     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
01043     return atomic_read(&vhc->frame_num);
01044 }
01045 
01046 static const struct hc_driver vhci_hcd = {
01047     .description      = driver_name,
01048     .product_desc     = "VHCI Host Controller",
01049     .hcd_priv_size    = sizeof(struct vhci),
01050 
01051     .flags            = HCD_USB2,
01052 
01053     .start            = vhci_start,
01054     .stop             = vhci_stop,
01055 
01056     .urb_enqueue      = vhci_urb_enqueue,
01057     .urb_dequeue      = vhci_urb_dequeue,
01058 
01059     .get_frame_number = vhci_get_frame,
01060 
01061     .hub_status_data  = vhci_hub_status,
01062     .hub_control      = vhci_hub_control,
01063     .bus_suspend      = vhci_bus_suspend,
01064     .bus_resume       = vhci_bus_resume
01065 };
01066 
01067 static int vhci_hcd_probe(struct platform_device *pdev)
01068 {
01069     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
01070     int retval;
01071 
01072 #ifdef DEBUG
01073     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(&pdev->dev, "%s\n", __FUNCTION__);
01074 #endif
01075     dev_info(&pdev->dev, DRIVER_DESC "  Ver. " DRIVER_VERSION "\n");
01076 
01077     hcd = usb_create_hcd(&vhci_hcd, &pdev->dev, pdev->dev.bus_id);
01078     if(unlikely(!hcd)) return -ENOMEM;
01079 
01080     retval = usb_add_hcd(hcd, 0, 0);
01081     if(unlikely(retval)) usb_put_hcd(hcd);
01082 
01083     return retval;
01084 }
01085 
01086 static int vhci_hcd_remove(struct platform_device *pdev)
01087 {
01088     unsigned long flags;
01089     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
01090     struct vhci *vhc;
01091     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
01092 
01093     hcd = platform_get_drvdata(pdev);
01094     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
01095 
01096     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
01097 
01098     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01099     while(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_inbox))
01100     {
01101         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_inbox.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01102         maybe_set_status(urbp, -ESHUTDOWN);
01103         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01104     }
01105     while(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_fetched))
01106     {
01107         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_fetched.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01108         maybe_set_status(urbp, -ESHUTDOWN);
01109         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01110     }
01111     while(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_cancel))
01112     {
01113         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_cancel.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01114         maybe_set_status(urbp, -ESHUTDOWN);
01115         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01116     }
01117     while(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_canceling))
01118     {
01119         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_canceling.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01120         maybe_set_status(urbp, -ESHUTDOWN);
01121         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01122     }
01123     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01124 
01125     usb_remove_hcd(hcd);
01126     usb_put_hcd(hcd);
01127 
01128     return 0;
01129 }
01130 
01131 static int vhci_hcd_suspend(struct platform_device *pdev, pm_message_t state)
01132 {
01133     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
01134     struct vhci *vhc;
01135     int rc = 0;
01136 
01137     hcd = platform_get_drvdata(pdev);
01138     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
01139 
01140     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
01141 
01142     if(unlikely(vhc->rh_state == VHCI_RH_RUNNING))
01143     {
01144         dev_warn(&pdev->dev, "Root hub isn't suspended! You have to suspend the root hub before you suspend the host controller device.\n");
01145         rc = -EBUSY;
01146     }
01147     else
01148         clear_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags);
01149 
01150     return rc;
01151 }
01152 
01153 static int vhci_hcd_resume(struct platform_device *pdev)
01154 {
01155     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
01156     struct vhci *vhc;
01157 
01158     hcd = platform_get_drvdata(pdev);
01159     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
01160     trace_function(vhci_dev(vhc));
01161 
01162     set_bit(HCD_FLAG_HW_ACCESSIBLE, &hcd->flags);
01163     usb_hcd_poll_rh_status(hcd);
01164     return 0;
01165 }
01166 
01167 static struct platform_driver vhci_hcd_driver = {
01168     .probe      = vhci_hcd_probe,
01169     .remove     = vhci_hcd_remove,
01170     .suspend    = vhci_hcd_suspend,
01171     .resume     = vhci_hcd_resume,
01172     .driver     = {
01173         .name   = driver_name,
01174         .owner  = THIS_MODULE
01175     }
01176 };
01177 
01178 // Callback Funktion f√ºr driver_for_each_device(..) in ioc_register(...).
01179 // data zeigt auf device id, die gepr√ºft werden soll.
01180 // Funktion liefert Fehler zur√ºck, wenn das Device die zu pr√ºfende id belegt (Enumeration wird bei
01181 // Fehler abgebrochen.).
01182 static int device_enum(struct device *dev, void *data)
01183 {
01184     struct platform_device *pdev;
01185     pdev = to_platform_device(dev);
01186     return unlikely(*((const int *)data) == pdev->id) ? -EINVAL : 0;
01187 }
01188 
01189 static spinlock_t dev_enum_lock = SPIN_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
01190 
01191 static int device_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01192 {
01193     vhci_dbg("%s(inode=%p, file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, inode, file);
01194 
01195     if(unlikely(file->private_data != NULL))
01196     {
01197         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "file->private_data != NULL (Da is schon vor mir einer drueber grutscht.)\n");
01198         return -EINVAL;
01199     }
01200 
01201     try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
01202     return 0;
01203 }
01204 
01205 // called in device_ioctl only
01206 static inline int ioc_register(struct file *file, struct vhci_ioc_register __user *arg)
01207 {
01208     int retval, i, usbbusnum;
01209     struct platform_device *pdev;
01210     struct vhci_conf *conf;
01211     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
01212     u8 pc;
01213 
01214     vhci_dbg("cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER\n");
01215 
01216     BUG_ON(in_interrupt());
01217 
01218     if(unlikely(file->private_data))
01219     {
01220         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "file->private_data != NULL (VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER already done?)\n");
01221         return -EPROTO;
01222     }
01223 
01224     __get_user(pc, &arg->port_count);
01225     if(pc > 31)
01226         return -EINVAL;
01227 
01228     // Nach freier device id suchen
01229     spin_lock(&dev_enum_lock);
01230     for(i = 0; i < 10000; i++)
01231     {
01232         retval = driver_for_each_device(&vhci_hcd_driver.driver, NULL, &i, device_enum);
01233         if(unlikely(!retval)) break;
01234     }
01235     if(unlikely(i >= 10000))
01236     {
01237         spin_unlock(&dev_enum_lock);
01238         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "there are too much devices!\n");
01239         return -EBUSY;
01240     }
01241 
01242     vhci_dbg("allocate platform_device %s.%d\n", driver_name, i);
01243     pdev = platform_device_alloc(driver_name, i);
01244     if(unlikely(!pdev))
01245     {
01246         spin_unlock(&dev_enum_lock);
01247         return -ENOMEM;
01248     }
01249 
01250     vhci_dbg("associate ptr to file structure with platform_device\n");
01251     retval = platform_device_add_data(pdev, &file, sizeof(struct file *));
01252     if(unlikely(retval < 0))
01253     {
01254         spin_unlock(&dev_enum_lock);
01255         goto pdev_put;
01256     }
01257 
01258     vhci_dbg("allocate and associate vhci_conf structure with file->private_data\n");
01259     conf = kmalloc(sizeof(struct vhci_conf), GFP_KERNEL);
01260     if(unlikely(!conf))
01261     {
01262         spin_unlock(&dev_enum_lock);
01263         retval = -ENOMEM;
01264         goto pdev_put;
01265     }
01266     conf->pdev = pdev;
01267     conf->port_count = pc;
01268     file->private_data = conf;
01269 
01270     vhci_dbg("register platform_device %s.%d\n", pdev->name, pdev->id);
01271     retval = platform_device_register(pdev);
01272     spin_unlock(&dev_enum_lock);
01273     if(unlikely(retval < 0))
01274     {
01275         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "register platform_device %s.%d failed\n", pdev->name, pdev->id);
01276         kfree(conf);
01277         file->private_data = NULL;
01278         goto pdev_put;
01279     }
01280 
01281     // ID in Userspace kopieren
01282     __put_user(pdev->id, &arg->id);
01283 
01284     // Bus-ID in Userspace kopieren
01285     i = (BUS_ID_SIZE < 20) ? BUS_ID_SIZE : 20;
01286     if(copy_to_user(arg->bus_id, pdev->dev.bus_id, i - 1))
01287     {
01288         vhci_printk(KERN_WARNING, "Failed to copy bus_id to userspace.\n");
01289         __put_user('\0', arg->bus_id);
01290     }
01291     // Daf√ºr sorgen, dass letztes Zeichen auf jeden Fall Null ist
01292     __put_user('\0', arg->bus_id + i - 1);
01293 
01294     hcd = platform_get_drvdata(pdev);
01295     usbbusnum = hcd->self.busnum;
01296     vhci_printk(KERN_INFO, "Usb bus #%d\n", usbbusnum);
01297     __put_user(usbbusnum, &arg->usb_busnum);
01298 
01299     return 0;
01300 
01301 pdev_put:
01302     platform_device_put(pdev);
01303     return retval;
01304 }
01305 
01306 static int device_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01307 {
01308     struct vhci_conf *conf;
01309 
01310     vhci_dbg("%s(inode=%p, file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, inode, file);
01311 
01312     conf = file->private_data;
01313     file->private_data = NULL;
01314 
01315     if(likely(conf))
01316     {
01317         vhci_dbg("unregister platform_device %s\n", conf->pdev->dev.bus_id);
01318         platform_device_unregister(conf->pdev);
01319 
01320         kfree(conf);
01321     }
01322     else
01323     {
01324         vhci_dbg("was not configured\n");
01325     }
01326 
01327     module_put(THIS_MODULE);
01328     return 0;
01329 }
01330 
01331 static ssize_t device_read(struct file *file,
01332                            char __user *buffer,
01333                            size_t length,
01334                            loff_t *offset)
01335 {
01336     vhci_dbg("%s(file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, file);
01337     return -ENODEV;
01338 }
01339 
01340 static ssize_t device_write(struct file *file,
01341                             const char __user *buffer,
01342                             size_t length,
01343                             loff_t *offset)
01344 {
01345     vhci_dbg("%s(file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, file);
01346     return -ENODEV;
01347 }
01348 
01349 // called in device_ioctl only
01350 static inline int ioc_port_stat(struct vhci *vhc, struct vhci_ioc_port_stat __user *arg)
01351 {
01352     unsigned long flags;
01353     u8 index;
01354     u16 status, change, overcurrent;
01355 
01356 #ifdef DEBUG
01357     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCPORTSTAT\n");
01358 #endif
01359 
01360     __get_user(status, &arg->status);
01361     __get_user(change, &arg->change);
01362     __get_user(index, &arg->index);
01363     if(unlikely(!index || index > vhc->port_count))
01364         return -EINVAL;
01365 
01366     if(unlikely(change != USB_PORT_STAT_C_CONNECTION &&
01367                 change != USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE &&
01368                 change != USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND &&
01369                 change != USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT &&
01370                 change != USB_PORT_STAT_C_RESET &&
01371                 change != (USB_PORT_STAT_C_RESET | USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE)))
01372         return -EINVAL;
01373 
01374     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01375     if(unlikely(!(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_POWER)))
01376     {
01377         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01378         return -EPROTO;
01379     }
01380 
01381 #ifdef DEBUG
01382     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "performing PORT_STAT [port=%d ~status=0x%04x ~change=0x%04x]\n", (int)index, (int)status, (int)change);
01383 #endif
01384 
01385     switch(change)
01386     {
01387     case USB_PORT_STAT_C_CONNECTION:
01388         overcurrent = vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
01389         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_CONNECTION;
01390         if(status & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION)
01391             vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status = USB_PORT_STAT_POWER | USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION |
01392                 ((status & USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED) ? USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED :
01393                 ((status & USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED) ? USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED : 0)) |
01394                 overcurrent;
01395         else
01396             vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status = USB_PORT_STAT_POWER | overcurrent;
01397         __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)&vhc->ports[index - 1].port_flags);
01398         break;
01399 
01400     case USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE:
01401         if(unlikely(!(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION) ||
01402             (vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET) ||
01403             (status & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE)))
01404         {
01405             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01406             return -EPROTO;
01407         }
01408         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE;
01409         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status &= ~USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE;
01410         __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)&vhc->ports[index - 1].port_flags);
01411         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status &= ~USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND;
01412         break;
01413 
01414     case USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND:
01415         if(unlikely(!(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION) ||
01416             !(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE) ||
01417             (vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET) ||
01418             (status & USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND)))
01419         {
01420             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01421             return -EPROTO;
01422         }
01423         __clear_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)&vhc->ports[index - 1].port_flags);
01424         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND;
01425         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status &= ~USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND;
01426         break;
01427 
01428     case USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT:
01429         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT;
01430         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status &= ~USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
01431         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status |= status & USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT;
01432         break;
01433 
01434     default: // USB_PORT_STAT_C_RESET [| USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE]
01435         if(unlikely(!(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION) ||
01436             !(vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET) ||
01437             (status & USB_PORT_STAT_RESET)))
01438         {
01439             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01440             return -EPROTO;
01441         }
01442         if(change & USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE)
01443         {
01444             if(status & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE)
01445             {
01446                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01447                 return -EPROTO;
01448             }
01449             vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE;
01450         }
01451         else
01452             vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status |= status & USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE;
01453         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_change |= USB_PORT_STAT_C_RESET;
01454         vhc->ports[index - 1].port_status &= ~USB_PORT_STAT_RESET;
01455         break;
01456     }
01457 
01458     userspace_needs_port_update(vhc, index);
01459     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01460 
01461     usb_hcd_poll_rh_status(vhci_to_hcd(vhc));
01462     return 0;
01463 }
01464 
01465 static inline u8 conv_urb_type(u8 type)
01466 {
01467     switch(type & 0x3)
01468     {
01469     case PIPE_ISOCHRONOUS: return VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_ISO;
01470     case PIPE_INTERRUPT:   return VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_INT;
01471     case PIPE_BULK:        return VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_BULK;
01472     default:               return VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_CONTROL;
01473     }
01474 }
01475 
01476 static inline u16 conv_urb_flags(unsigned int flags)
01477 {
01478     return ((flags & URB_SHORT_NOT_OK) ? VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_SHORT_NOT_OK : 0) |
01479            ((flags & URB_ISO_ASAP)     ? VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_ISO_ASAP     : 0) |
01480            ((flags & URB_ZERO_PACKET)  ? VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_ZERO_PACKET  : 0);
01481 }
01482 
01483 static int has_work(struct vhci *vhc)
01484 {
01485     unsigned long flags;
01486     int y = 0;
01487     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01488     if(vhc->port_update ||
01489         !list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_cancel) ||
01490         !list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_inbox))
01491         y = 1;
01492     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01493     return y;
01494 }
01495 
01496 // called in device_ioctl only
01497 static inline int ioc_fetch_work(struct vhci *vhc, struct vhci_ioc_work __user *arg)
01498 {
01499     unsigned long flags;
01500     u8 _port, port;
01501     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
01502     long wret;
01503 
01504 #ifdef DEBUG
01505     // Floods the logs
01506     //if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK\n");
01507 #endif
01508 
01509     wret = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(vhc->work_event, has_work(vhc), msecs_to_jiffies(100));
01510     if(unlikely(wret < 0))
01511     {
01512         if(likely(wret == -ERESTARTSYS))
01513             return -EINTR;
01514         return wret;
01515     }
01516     else if(!wret)
01517         return -ETIMEDOUT;
01518 
01519     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01520     if(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_cancel))
01521     {
01522         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_cancel.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01523 #ifdef DEBUG
01524         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK [work=CANCEL_URB handle=0x%016llx]\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb);
01525 #endif
01526         __put_user(VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_CANCEL_URB, &arg->type);
01527         __put_user((u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb, &arg->handle);
01528         list_move_tail(&urbp->urbp_list, &vhc->urbp_list_canceling);
01529         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01530         return 0;
01531     }
01532 
01533     if(vhc->port_update)
01534     {
01535         if(vhc->port_sched_offset >= vhc->port_count)
01536             vhc->port_sched_offset = 0;
01537         for(_port = 0; _port < vhc->port_count; _port++)
01538         {
01539             port = (_port + vhc->port_sched_offset) % vhc->port_count;
01540             if(__test_and_clear_bit(port + 1, (unsigned long *)&vhc->port_update))
01541             {
01542                 vhc->port_sched_offset = port + 1;
01543 #ifdef DEBUG
01544                 if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK [work=PORT_STAT port=%d status=0x%04x change=0x%04x]\n", (int)(port + 1), (int)vhc->ports[port].port_status, (int)vhc->ports[port].port_change);
01545 #endif
01546                 __put_user(VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PORT_STAT, &arg->type);
01547                 __put_user(port + 1, &arg->work.port.index);
01548                 __put_user(vhc->ports[port].port_status, &arg->work.port.status);
01549                 __put_user(vhc->ports[port].port_change, &arg->work.port.change);
01550                 __put_user(test_bit(VHCI_PORT_FLAGS_RESUMING, (unsigned long *)&vhc->ports[port].port_flags)
01551                     ? (1 << VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING) : 0, &arg->work.port.flags);
01552                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01553                 return 0;
01554             }
01555         }
01556     }
01557 
01558 repeat:
01559     if(!list_empty(&vhc->urbp_list_inbox))
01560     {
01561         urbp = list_entry(vhc->urbp_list_inbox.next, struct vhci_urb_priv, urbp_list);
01562         __put_user(VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PROCESS_URB, &arg->type);
01563         __put_user((u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb, &arg->handle);
01564         __put_user(usb_pipedevice(urbp->urb->pipe), &arg->work.urb.address);
01565         __put_user(usb_pipeendpoint(urbp->urb->pipe) | (usb_pipein(urbp->urb->pipe) ? 0x80 : 0x00), &arg->work.urb.endpoint);
01566         __put_user(conv_urb_type(usb_pipetype(urbp->urb->pipe)), &arg->work.urb.type);
01567         __put_user(conv_urb_flags(urbp->urb->transfer_flags), &arg->work.urb.flags);
01568         if(usb_pipecontrol(urbp->urb->pipe))
01569         {
01570             const struct usb_ctrlrequest *cmd;
01571             u16 wValue, wIndex, wLength;
01572             if(unlikely(!urbp->urb->setup_packet))
01573                 goto invalid_urb;
01574             cmd = (struct usb_ctrlrequest *)urbp->urb->setup_packet;
01575             wValue = le16_to_cpu(cmd->wValue);
01576             wIndex = le16_to_cpu(cmd->wIndex);
01577             wLength = le16_to_cpu(cmd->wLength);
01578             if(unlikely(wLength > urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length))
01579                 goto invalid_urb;
01580             if(cmd->bRequestType & 0x80)
01581             {
01582                 if(unlikely(!wLength || !urbp->urb->transfer_buffer))
01583                     goto invalid_urb;
01584             }
01585             else
01586             {
01587                 if(unlikely(wLength && !urbp->urb->transfer_buffer))
01588                     goto invalid_urb;
01589             }
01590             __put_user(wLength, &arg->work.urb.buffer_length);
01591             __put_user(cmd->bRequestType, &arg->work.urb.setup_packet.bmRequestType);
01592             __put_user(cmd->bRequest, &arg->work.urb.setup_packet.bRequest);
01593             __put_user(wValue, &arg->work.urb.setup_packet.wValue);
01594             __put_user(wIndex, &arg->work.urb.setup_packet.wIndex);
01595             __put_user(wLength, &arg->work.urb.setup_packet.wLength);
01596         }
01597         else
01598         {
01599             if(usb_pipein(urbp->urb->pipe))
01600             {
01601                 if(unlikely(!urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length || !urbp->urb->transfer_buffer))
01602                     goto invalid_urb;
01603             }
01604             else
01605             {
01606                 if(unlikely(urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length && !urbp->urb->transfer_buffer))
01607                     goto invalid_urb;
01608             }
01609             __put_user(urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length, &arg->work.urb.buffer_length);
01610         }
01611         __put_user(urbp->urb->interval, &arg->work.urb.interval);
01612         __put_user(urbp->urb->number_of_packets, &arg->work.urb.packet_count);
01613 
01614 #ifdef DEBUG
01615         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK [work=PROCESS_URB handle=0x%016llx]\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb);
01616 #endif
01617         dump_urb(urbp->urb);
01618         list_move_tail(&urbp->urbp_list, &vhc->urbp_list_fetched);
01619         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01620         return 0;
01621 
01622     invalid_urb:
01623         // Ungueltige URBs gleich wieder abschieben
01624 #ifdef DEBUG
01625         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK  <<< THROWING AWAY INVALID URB >>>  [handle=0x%016llx]\n", (u64)(unsigned long)urbp->urb);
01626 #endif
01627         maybe_set_status(urbp, -EPIPE);
01628         vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01629         goto repeat;
01630     }
01631 
01632     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01633     return -ENODATA;
01634 }
01635 
01636 // caller has lock
01637 static inline struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp_from_handle(struct vhci *vhc, const void *handle)
01638 {
01639     struct vhci_urb_priv *entry;
01640     list_for_each_entry(entry, &vhc->urbp_list_fetched, urbp_list)
01641         if(entry->urb == handle)
01642             return entry;
01643     return NULL;
01644 }
01645 
01646 // caller has lock
01647 static inline struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp_from_handle_in_cancel(struct vhci *vhc, const void *handle)
01648 {
01649     struct vhci_urb_priv *entry;
01650     list_for_each_entry(entry, &vhc->urbp_list_cancel, urbp_list)
01651         if(entry->urb == handle)
01652             return entry;
01653     return NULL;
01654 }
01655 
01656 // caller has lock
01657 static inline struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp_from_handle_in_canceling(struct vhci *vhc, const void *handle)
01658 {
01659     struct vhci_urb_priv *entry;
01660     list_for_each_entry(entry, &vhc->urbp_list_canceling, urbp_list)
01661         if(entry->urb == handle)
01662             return entry;
01663     return NULL;
01664 }
01665 
01666 // caller has lock
01667 static inline int is_urb_dir_in(const struct urb *urb)
01668 {
01669     if(unlikely(usb_pipecontrol(urb->pipe)))
01670     {
01671         const struct usb_ctrlrequest *cmd = (struct usb_ctrlrequest *)urb->setup_packet;
01672         return cmd->bRequestType & 0x80;
01673     }
01674     else
01675         return usb_pipein(urb->pipe);
01676 }
01677 
01678 // -ECANCELED stellt keinen Fehler dar, sondern zeigt an, dass sich der URB in der
01679 // Cancel- oder Canceling-Liste befand.
01680 // Im Fehlerfall wird der URB, falls der Handle gefunden wurde, ebenfalls an den Erzeuger
01681 // zur√ºckgegeben.
01682 // called in ioc_giveback{,32} only
01683 static inline int ioc_giveback_common(struct vhci *vhc, const void *handle, int status, int act, int iso_count, int err_count, const void __user *buf, const struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback __user *iso)
01684 {
01685     unsigned long flags;
01686     int retval = 0, is_in, is_iso, i;
01687     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
01688 
01689     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01690     if(unlikely(!(urbp = urbp_from_handle(vhc, handle))))
01691     {
01692         // Falls nicht gefunden, nachschauen, ob in Cancel{,ing}-Liste
01693         if(likely((urbp = urbp_from_handle_in_canceling(vhc, handle)) ||
01694             (urbp = urbp_from_handle_in_cancel(vhc, handle))))
01695         {
01696 #ifdef DEBUG
01697             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: urb was canceled\n");
01698 #endif
01699             retval = -ECANCELED;
01700         }
01701         else
01702         {
01703 #ifdef DEBUG
01704             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: handle not found\n");
01705 #endif
01706             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01707             return -ENOENT;
01708         }
01709     }
01710 
01711     is_in = is_urb_dir_in(urbp->urb);
01712     is_iso = usb_pipeisoc(urbp->urb->pipe);
01713 
01714     if(likely(is_iso))
01715     {
01716         if(unlikely(is_in && act != urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length))
01717         {
01718 #ifdef DEBUG
01719             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK(ISO): invalid: buffer_actual != buffer_length\n");
01720 #endif
01721             retval = -ENOBUFS;
01722             goto done_with_errors;
01723         }
01724         if(unlikely(iso_count != urbp->urb->number_of_packets))
01725         {
01726 #ifdef DEBUG
01727             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK(ISO): invalid: number_of_packets missmatch\n");
01728 #endif
01729             retval = -EINVAL;
01730             goto done_with_errors;
01731         }
01732         if(unlikely(iso_count && !iso))
01733         {
01734 #ifdef DEBUG
01735             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK(ISO): invalid: iso_packets must not be zero\n");
01736 #endif
01737             retval = -EINVAL;
01738             goto done_with_errors;
01739         }
01740         if(likely(iso_count))
01741         {
01742             if(!access_ok(VERIFY_READ, (void *)iso, iso_count * sizeof(struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback)))
01743             {
01744                 retval = -EFAULT;
01745                 goto done_with_errors;
01746             }
01747         }
01748     }
01749     else if(unlikely(act > urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length))
01750     {
01751 #ifdef DEBUG
01752         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: invalid: buffer_actual > buffer_length\n");
01753 #endif
01754         retval = is_in ? -ENOBUFS : -EINVAL;
01755         goto done_with_errors;
01756     }
01757     if(is_in)
01758     {
01759         if(unlikely(act && !buf))
01760         {
01761 #ifdef DEBUG
01762             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: buf must not be zero\n");
01763 #endif
01764             retval = -EINVAL;
01765             goto done_with_errors;
01766         }
01767         if(unlikely(copy_from_user(urbp->urb->transfer_buffer, buf, act)))
01768         {
01769 #ifdef DEBUG
01770             if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: copy_from_user(buf) failed\n");
01771 #endif
01772             retval = -EFAULT;
01773             goto done_with_errors;
01774         }
01775     }
01776     else if(unlikely(buf))
01777     {
01778 #ifdef DEBUG
01779         if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: invalid: buf should be NULL\n");
01780 #endif
01781         // Erwartet keine Daten, also sollte buf NULL sein
01782         retval = -EINVAL;
01783         goto done_with_errors;
01784     }
01785     if(likely(is_iso && iso_count))
01786     {
01787         for(i = 0; i < iso_count; i++)
01788         {
01789             __get_user(urbp->urb->iso_frame_desc[i].status, &iso[i].status);
01790             __get_user(urbp->urb->iso_frame_desc[i].actual_length, &iso[i].packet_actual);
01791         }
01792     }
01793     urbp->urb->actual_length = act;
01794     urbp->urb->error_count = err_count;
01795 
01796     // Jetzt ist der URB fertig und darf wieder zu seinem Erzeuger zur√ºck
01797     maybe_set_status(urbp, status);
01798     vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01799     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01800 #ifdef DEBUG
01801     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: done\n");
01802 #endif
01803     return retval;
01804 
01805 done_with_errors:
01806     vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01807     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01808 #ifdef DEBUG
01809     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "GIVEBACK: done (with errors)\n");
01810 #endif
01811     return retval;
01812 }
01813 
01814 // called in device_ioctl only
01815 static inline int ioc_giveback(struct vhci *vhc, const struct vhci_ioc_giveback __user *arg)
01816 {
01817     u64 handle64;
01818     const void *handle;
01819     const void __user *buf;
01820     const struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback __user *iso;
01821     int status, act, iso_count, err_count;
01822 
01823 #ifdef DEBUF
01824     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK\n");
01825 #endif
01826 
01827     if(sizeof(void *) > 4)
01828         __get_user(handle64, &arg->handle);
01829     else
01830     {
01831         u32 handle1, handle2;
01832         __get_user(handle1, (u32 __user *)&arg->handle);
01833         __get_user(handle2, (u32 __user *)&arg->handle + 1);
01834         *((u32 *)&handle64) = handle1;
01835         *((u32 *)&handle64 + 1) = handle2;
01836         if(handle64 >> 32)
01837             return -EINVAL;
01838     }
01839     __get_user(status, &arg->status);
01840     __get_user(act, &arg->buffer_actual);
01841     __get_user(iso_count, &arg->packet_count);
01842     __get_user(err_count, &arg->error_count);
01843     __get_user(buf, &arg->buffer);
01844     __get_user(iso, &arg->iso_packets);
01845     handle = (const void *)(unsigned long)handle64;
01846     if(unlikely(!handle))
01847         return -EINVAL;
01848     return ioc_giveback_common(vhc, handle, status, act, iso_count, err_count, buf, iso);
01849 }
01850 
01851 // called in ioc_fetch_data{,32} only
01852 static inline int ioc_fetch_data_common(struct vhci *vhc, const void *handle, void __user *user_buf, int user_len, struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data __user *iso, int iso_count)
01853 {
01854     unsigned long flags;
01855     int tb_len, is_in, is_iso, i;
01856     struct vhci_urb_priv *urbp;
01857 
01858     spin_lock_irqsave(&vhc->lock, flags);
01859     if(unlikely(!(urbp = urbp_from_handle(vhc, handle))))
01860     {
01861         // Falls nicht gefunden, nachschauen, ob in Cancel{,ing}-Liste
01862         if(likely((urbp = urbp_from_handle_in_cancel(vhc, handle)) ||
01863             (urbp = urbp_from_handle_in_canceling(vhc, handle))))
01864         {
01865             // URB an Erzeuger zur√ºckgeben, weil Userspace weis jetzt, dass abgebrochen
01866             vhci_urb_giveback(vhc, urbp);
01867             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01868             return -ECANCELED;
01869         }
01870         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01871         return -ENOENT;
01872     }
01873 
01874     tb_len = urbp->urb->transfer_buffer_length;
01875     if(unlikely(usb_pipecontrol(urbp->urb->pipe)))
01876     {
01877         const struct usb_ctrlrequest *cmd = (struct usb_ctrlrequest *)urbp->urb->setup_packet;
01878         tb_len = le16_to_cpu(cmd->wLength);
01879     }
01880 
01881     is_in = is_urb_dir_in(urbp->urb);
01882     is_iso = usb_pipeisoc(urbp->urb->pipe);
01883 
01884     if(likely(is_iso))
01885     {
01886         if(unlikely(iso_count != urbp->urb->number_of_packets))
01887         {
01888             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01889             return -EINVAL;
01890         }
01891         if(likely(iso_count))
01892         {
01893             if(unlikely(!iso))
01894             {
01895                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01896                 return -EINVAL;
01897             }
01898             if(!access_ok(VERIFY_WRITE, (void *)iso, iso_count * sizeof(struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data)))
01899             {
01900                 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01901                 return -EFAULT;
01902             }
01903             for(i = 0; i < iso_count; i++)
01904             {
01905                 __put_user(urbp->urb->iso_frame_desc[i].offset, &iso[i].offset);
01906                 __put_user(urbp->urb->iso_frame_desc[i].length, &iso[i].packet_length);
01907             }
01908         }
01909     }
01910     else if(unlikely(is_in || !tb_len || !urbp->urb->transfer_buffer))
01911     {
01912         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01913         return -ENODATA;
01914     }
01915 
01916     if(likely(!is_in && tb_len))
01917     {
01918         if(unlikely(!user_buf || user_len < tb_len))
01919         {
01920             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01921             return -EINVAL;
01922         }
01923         if(unlikely(copy_to_user(user_buf, urbp->urb->transfer_buffer, tb_len)))
01924         {
01925             spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01926             return -EFAULT;
01927         }
01928     }
01929     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&vhc->lock, flags);
01930     return 0;
01931 }
01932 
01933 // called in device_ioctl only
01934 static inline int ioc_fetch_data(struct vhci *vhc, struct vhci_ioc_urb_data __user *arg)
01935 {
01936     u64 handle64;
01937     const void *handle;
01938     void __user *user_buf;
01939     struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data __user *iso;
01940     int user_len, iso_count;
01941 
01942 #ifdef DEBUG
01943     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA\n");
01944 #endif
01945     if(sizeof(void *) > 4)
01946         __get_user(handle64, &arg->handle);
01947     else
01948     {
01949         u32 handle1, handle2;
01950         __get_user(handle1, (u32 __user *)&arg->handle);
01951         __get_user(handle2, (u32 __user *)&arg->handle + 1);
01952         *((u32 *)&handle64) = handle1;
01953         *((u32 *)&handle64 + 1) = handle2;
01954         if(handle64 >> 32)
01955             return -EINVAL;
01956     }
01957     __get_user(user_len, &arg->buffer_length);
01958     __get_user(iso_count, &arg->packet_count);
01959     __get_user(user_buf, &arg->buffer);
01960     __get_user(iso, &arg->iso_packets);
01961     handle = (const void *)(unsigned long)handle64;
01962     if(unlikely(!handle))
01963         return -EINVAL;
01964     return ioc_fetch_data_common(vhc, handle, user_buf, user_len, iso, iso_count);
01965 }
01966 
01967 #ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
01968 // called in device_ioctl only
01969 static inline int ioc_giveback32(struct vhci *vhc, const struct vhci_ioc_giveback32 __user *arg)
01970 {
01971     u64 handle64;
01972     const void *handle;
01973     u32 buf32, iso32;
01974     const void __user *buf;
01975     const struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback __user *iso;
01976     int status, act, iso_count, err_count;
01977 
01978 #ifdef DEBUG
01979     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK32\n");
01980 #endif
01981     __get_user(handle64, &arg->handle);
01982     __get_user(status, &arg->status);
01983     __get_user(act, &arg->buffer_actual);
01984     __get_user(iso_count, &arg->packet_count);
01985     __get_user(err_count, &arg->error_count);
01986     __get_user(buf32, &arg->buffer);
01987     __get_user(iso32, &arg->iso_packets);
01988     handle = (const void *)(unsigned long)handle64;
01989     if(unlikely(!handle))
01990         return -EINVAL;
01991     buf = compat_ptr(buf32);
01992     iso = compat_ptr(iso32);
01993     return ioc_giveback_common(vhc, handle, status, act, iso_count, err_count, buf, iso);
01994 }
01995 
01996 // called in device_ioctl only
01997 static inline int ioc_fetch_data32(struct vhci *vhc, struct vhci_ioc_urb_data32 __user *arg)
01998 {
01999     u64 handle64;
02000     const void *handle;
02001     u32 user_buf32, iso32;
02002     void __user *user_buf;
02003     struct vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data __user *iso;
02004     int user_len, iso_count;
02005 
02006 #ifdef DEBUG
02007     if(debug_output) dev_dbg(vhci_dev(vhc), "cmd=VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA32\n");
02008 #endif
02009 
02010     __get_user(handle64, &arg->handle);
02011     __get_user(user_len, &arg->buffer_length);
02012     __get_user(iso_count, &arg->packet_count);
02013     __get_user(user_buf32, &arg->buffer);
02014     __get_user(iso32, &arg->iso_packets);
02015     handle = (const void *)(unsigned long)handle64;
02016     if(unlikely(!handle))
02017         return -EINVAL;
02018     user_buf = compat_ptr(user_buf32);
02019     iso = compat_ptr(iso32);
02020     return ioc_fetch_data_common(vhc, handle, user_buf, user_len, iso, iso_count);
02021 }
02022 #endif
02023 
02024 static int device_ioctl(struct inode *inode,
02025                         struct file *file,
02026                         unsigned int cmd,
02027                         unsigned long arg)
02028 {
02029     struct vhci_conf *conf;
02030     struct usb_hcd *hcd;
02031     struct vhci *vhc;
02032     int ret = 0;
02033 
02034     // Floods the logs
02035     //vhci_dbg("%s(file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, file);
02036 
02037     if(unlikely(_IOC_TYPE(cmd) != VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC)) return -ENOTTY;
02038     if(unlikely(_IOC_NR(cmd) > VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAXNR)) return -ENOTTY;
02039 
02040     if(unlikely((_IOC_DIR(cmd) & _IOC_READ) && !access_ok(VERIFY_WRITE, (void *)arg, _IOC_SIZE(cmd))))
02041         return -EFAULT;
02042     if(unlikely((_IOC_DIR(cmd) & _IOC_WRITE) && !access_ok(VERIFY_READ, (void *)arg, _IOC_SIZE(cmd))))
02043         return -EFAULT;
02044 
02045     if(unlikely(cmd == VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER))
02046         return ioc_register(file, (struct vhci_ioc_register __user *)arg);
02047 
02048     conf = file->private_data;
02049 
02050     if(unlikely(!conf))
02051         return -EPROTO;
02052 
02053     hcd = platform_get_drvdata(conf->pdev);
02054     vhc = hcd_to_vhci(hcd);
02055 
02056     switch(__builtin_expect(cmd, VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK))
02057     {
02058     case VHCI_HCD_IOCPORTSTAT:
02059         ret = ioc_port_stat(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_port_stat __user *)arg);
02060         break;
02061 
02062     case VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK:
02063         ret = ioc_fetch_work(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_work __user *)arg);
02064         break;
02065 
02066     case VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK:
02067         ret = ioc_giveback(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_giveback __user *)arg);
02068         break;
02069 
02070     case VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA:
02071         ret = ioc_fetch_data(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_urb_data __user *)arg);
02072         break;
02073 
02074 #ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
02075     case VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK32:
02076         ret = ioc_giveback32(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_giveback32 __user *)arg);
02077         break;
02078 
02079     case VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA32:
02080         ret = ioc_fetch_data32(vhc, (struct vhci_ioc_urb_data32 __user *)arg);
02081         break;
02082 #endif
02083 
02084     default:
02085         ret = -ENOTTY;
02086     }
02087 
02088     return ret;
02089 }
02090 
02091 static loff_t device_llseek(struct file *file, loff_t offset, int origin)
02092 {
02093     vhci_dbg("%s(file=%p)\n", __FUNCTION__, file);
02094     return -ESPIPE;
02095 }
02096 
02097 static struct file_operations fops = {
02098     .owner   = THIS_MODULE,
02099     .llseek  = device_llseek,
02100     .read    = device_read,
02101     .write   = device_write,
02102     .ioctl   = device_ioctl,
02103     .open    = device_open,
02104     .release = device_release // a.k.a. close
02105 };
02106 
02107 #ifdef DEBUG
02108 static ssize_t show_debug_output(struct device_driver *drv, char *buf)
02109 {
02110     if(buf != NULL)
02111     {
02112         switch(debug_output)
02113         {
02114         case 0:  *buf = '0'; break; // No debug output
02115         case 1:  *buf = '1'; break; // Debug output without data buffer dumps
02116         case 2:  *buf = '2'; break; // Debug output with short data buffer dumps
02117         default: *buf = '3'; break; // Debug output with full data buffer dumps
02118         }
02119     }
02120     return 1;
02121 }
02122 
02123 static ssize_t store_debug_output(struct device_driver *drv, const char *buf, size_t count)
02124 {
02125     if(count != 1 || buf == NULL) return -EINVAL;
02126     switch(*buf)
02127     {
02128     case '0': debug_output = 0; return 1;
02129     case '1': debug_output = 1; return 1;
02130     case '2': debug_output = 2; return 1;
02131     case '3': debug_output = 3; return 1;
02132     }
02133     return -EINVAL;
02134 }
02135 
02136 static DRIVER_ATTR(debug_output, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR, show_debug_output, store_debug_output);
02137 #endif
02138 
02139 static void vhci_device_release(struct device *dev)
02140 {
02141 }
02142 
02143 static int vhci_major;
02144 
02145 static struct class vhci_class = {
02146     .owner = THIS_MODULE,
02147     .name = driver_name
02148 };
02149 
02150 static struct device vhci_device = {
02151     .class = &vhci_class,
02152     .release = vhci_device_release,
02153     //.init_name = "vhci-ctrl",  // erst ab 2.6.28, oder so
02154     .driver = &vhci_hcd_driver.driver
02155 };
02156 
02157 static int __init init(void)
02158 {
02159     int retval;
02160 
02161     if(usb_disabled()) return -ENODEV;
02162 
02163     vhci_printk(KERN_INFO, DRIVER_DESC "  Ver. " DRIVER_VERSION "\n");
02164 
02165 #ifdef DEBUG
02166     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "register platform_driver %s\n", driver_name);
02167 #endif
02168     retval = platform_driver_register(&vhci_hcd_driver);
02169     if(unlikely(retval < 0))
02170     {
02171         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "register platform_driver failed\n");
02172         return retval;
02173     }
02174 
02175     vhci_major = register_chrdev(0, driver_name, &fops);
02176     if(unlikely(vhci_major < 0))
02177     {
02178         vhci_printk(KERN_ERR, "Sorry, registering the character device failed with %d.\n", retval);
02179 #ifdef DEBUG
02180         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "unregister platform_driver %s\n", driver_name);
02181 #endif
02182         platform_driver_unregister(&vhci_hcd_driver);
02183         return retval;
02184     }
02185 
02186     vhci_printk(KERN_INFO, "Successfully registered the character device.\n");
02187     vhci_printk(KERN_INFO, "The major device number is %d.\n", vhci_major);
02188 
02189     if(unlikely(class_register(&vhci_class)))
02190     {
02191         vhci_printk(KERN_WARNING, "failed to register class %s\n", driver_name);
02192     }
02193     else
02194     {
02195         strlcpy((void *)&vhci_device.bus_id, "vhci-ctrl", 10);
02196         vhci_device.devt = MKDEV(vhci_major, 0);
02197         if(unlikely(device_register(&vhci_device)))
02198         {
02199             vhci_printk(KERN_WARNING, "failed to register device %s\n", "vhci-ctrl");
02200         }
02201     }
02202 
02203 #ifdef DEBUG
02204     retval = driver_create_file(&vhci_hcd_driver.driver, &driver_attr_debug_output);
02205     if(unlikely(retval != 0))
02206     {
02207         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "driver_create_file(&vhci_hcd_driver, &driver_attr_debug_output) failed\n");
02208         vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "==> ignoring\n");
02209     }
02210 #endif
02211 
02212 #ifdef DEBUG
02213     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER  = %08x\n", (unsigned int)VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER);
02214     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "VHCI_HCD_IOCPORTSTAT  = %08x\n", (unsigned int)VHCI_HCD_IOCPORTSTAT);
02215     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK = %08x\n", (unsigned int)VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK);
02216     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK  = %08x\n", (unsigned int)VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK);
02217     vhci_printk(KERN_DEBUG, "VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA = %08x\n", (unsigned int)VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA);
02218 #endif
02219 
02220     return 0;
02221 }
02222 module_init(init);
02223 
02224 static void __exit cleanup(void)
02225 {
02226 #ifdef DEBUG
02227     driver_remove_file(&vhci_hcd_driver.driver, &driver_attr_debug_output);
02228 #endif
02229     device_unregister(&vhci_device);
02230     class_unregister(&vhci_class);
02231     unregister_chrdev(vhci_major, driver_name);
02232     vhci_dbg("unregister platform_driver %s\n", driver_name);
02233     platform_driver_unregister(&vhci_hcd_driver);
02234     vhci_dbg("bin weg\n");
02235 }
02236 module_exit(cleanup);
